IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO ENCOURAGE, BY PUBLIC CONTRIBUTION, SUPPORT OF WORTHWHILE EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PROJECTS OF INTEREST AND BENEFIT TO DEVOTEES OF THE AMERICAN QUARTER HORSE. TO OWN, OPERATE AND MAINTAIN THE HALL OF FAME AND MUSEUM. TO OFFER SCHOLARSHIP SUPPORT FOR SELECTED MEMBERS AND STUDENTS. TO OFFER FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR EQUINE RESEARCH.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO ENCOURAGE, BY PUBLIC CONTRIBUTION, SUPPORT OF WORTHWHILE EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PROJECTS OF INTEREST AND BENEFIT TO DEVOTEES OF THE AMERICAN QUARTER HORSE. TO OWN, OPERATE AND MAINTAIN THE AMERICAN QUARTER HORSE HALL OF FAME AND MUSEUM IN ORDER TO PRESERVE AND INTERPRET THE HISTORY AND MODERN USES OF THE BREED THROUGH EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS. TO OFFER SCHOLARSHIP SUPPORT FOR SELECTED MEMBERS OF THE AMERICAN QUARTER HORSE YOUTH ASSOCIATION AND STUDENTS PURSUING EDUCATION RELATED TO AMERICAN QUARTER HORSE RACING. TO OFFER FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR EQUINE RESEARCH.
IRS990.Description: HALL OF FAME AND MUSEUM - EXHIBITION OF THE HERITAGE OF THE AMERICAN QUARTER HORSE. SERVED 22,166 VISITORS 10/1/09 - 9/30/10.

Activity2.Description: EQUINE RESEARCH - PROVIDES FUNDING FOR EQUINE RESEARCH.

Activity3.Description: SCHOLARSHIP FUND - PROVISION OF SCHOLARSHIP TO YOUTHS MAKING IMPORTANT CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE PROMOTION AND PRESERVATION OF AMERICAN QUARTER HORSE. 188 SCHOLARSHIPS WERE PAID IN THE YEAR ENDED 9/30/10.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: HALL OF FAME INDUCTEE ARTIFACTS ARE ENCASED IN A TIMELINE FORMAT WITHIN THE ERA IN WHICH THEY MADE THEIR CONTRIBUTION TO THE BREED OR AQHA HISTORY.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: SCHOLARSHIP, EQUINE RESEARCH, THERAPEUTIC RIDING GRANTS, HALL OF FAME AND MUSEUM.

PART XII, LINE 2D: FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 64,797 COGS 702,340 GAMING ACTIVITIES EXPENSES 39,483 TOTAL ADJUSTMENTS 806,620 PART XIII, LINE 2D: FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 64,797 COGS 702,340 GAMING ACTIVITIES EXPENSES 39,483 TOTAL ADJUSTMENTS 806,620

IRS990ScheduleG.ExplanationIfNo: AQHF HOLDS A ONCE A YEAR RAFFLE, NO LICENSE IS REQUIRED IN OKLAHOMA.
IRS990ScheduleG.GamingManagerServicesProvided: MR. TAYLOR OVERSEES THE DISTRIBUTION OF THE RAFFLE TICKETS, COLLECTION OF FUNDS FROM THE SALE, THE DRAWING AND THE RECONCILIATION.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: > RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS FROM THE AMERICAN QUARTER HORSE FOUNDATION ARE SELECTED BY A COMMITTEE OF SIX PEOPLE WHO ARE REPRESENTATIVES FROM MAJOR FUNCTIONAL AREAS OF THE FOUNDATION AND AMERICAN QUARTER HORSE ASSOCIATION. APPLICANTS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT AN EXTENSIVE APPLICATION AND THREE LETTERS OF RECOMMENDATION. THE APPLICANTS ARE SCORED IN SIX AREAS: 1) FINANCIAL NEED 2) ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT 3) INVOLVEMENT IN THE QUARTER HORSE INDUSTRY 4) REFERENCES 5) ESSAYS 6) MEMBERSHIP THE COMMITTEE SELECTS THOSE WITH A GENUINE INTEREST IN THE EQUINE. THE SELECTION PROCESS IS DESIGNED TO PREVENT DISCRIMINATION. > RECIPIENTS OF EQUINE RESEARCH GRANTS SUBMIT APPLICATIONS TO THE AMERICAN QUARTER HORSE ASSOCIATION'S RESEARCH COMMITTEE AT THE ASSOCIATION'S ANNUAL CONVENTION. THE COMMITTEE EVALUATES THE APPLICATIONS AND RESEARCH PROJECTS. THE FOUNDATION ASSISTS IN FUNDING THE SELECTED APPLICANTS. > THE YOUTH WORLD SHOW ASSISTANCE FUND WAS SET UP TO MAKE FUNDS AVAILABLE FOR YOUTH TO ATTEND AQHA YOUTH WORLD CHAMPION SHOW. FUNDS ARE AWARDED BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AND FAMILY SITUATION, DETERMINED THROUGH AN APPLICATION PROCESS INCLUDING AN ESSAY WRITTEN BY THE YOUTH. ONLY YOUTH WHO STATE-QUALIFY ARE ELIGIBLE TO APPLY. AMOUNT OF FUNDING RECEIVED IS BASED ON AN EXPENSE-BASED FORMULA. > THE WILLIAM R. VERDUGO INTERNATIONAL INTERNSHIP PROGRAM FOR YOUNG ADULTS PROVIDES OPPORTUNITIES FOR MEMBERS OF THE ASSOCIATION AND THE AMERICAN QUARTER HORSE YOUTH ASSOCIATION TO PARTICIPATE IN HANDS-ON EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES BOTH IN THE U.S. AND IN AQHA AFFILIATE COUNTRIES. APPLICANTS MUST MEET AGE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS AND MUST SUBMIT AN EXTENSIVE APPLICATION TO A SELECTION COMMITTEE COMPOSED OF REPRESENTATIVES OF THE WILLIAM R. VERDUGO FAMILY AND THE AQHA INTERNATIONAL, PROFESSIONAL HORSEMEN'S AND FOUNDATION COMMITTEES. APPLICANTS ARE SELECTED USING A NUMERICAL SCORE FOR EACH COMPONENT OF THE APPLICATION-MEMBERSHIP, PERSONAL LETTER AND RESUME, REFERENCE LETTERS, AND VIDEO SUBMITTED. THE SELECTION PROCESS IS DESIGNED TO PREVENT DISCRIMINATION. > THE PROFESSIONAL HORSEMEN'S CRISIS FUND PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO APPLICANTS WHO MUST BE AQHA MEMBERS IN GOOD STANDING AND ALSO BE MEMBERS OF THE AQHA PROFESSIONAL HORSEMEN'S ASSOCIATION. IN EVALUATING EVIDENCE OF FINANCIAL NEED, CONSIDERATION SHALL BE GIVEN TO THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA: ANNUAL GROSS FAMILY INCOME, ANNUAL NET FAMILY INCOME, NUMBER OF CHILDREN OR OTHER DEPENDENTS COMPRISING THE FAMILY OF THE RECIPIENT, AVAILABILITY OF INSURANCE, ALTERNATE SOURCES OF INCOME, AND SEVERITY OF THE DISASTER, HARDSHIP OR ILLNESS. RECIPIENTS WILL BE SELECTED BY THE CRISIS FUND COMMITTEE, WHICH CONSISTS OF MEMBERS FROM BOTH THE FOUNDATION COMMITTEE AND PROFESSIONAL HORSEMEN'S COUNCIL. > AMERICA'S HORSE CARES GRANT PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO THERAPEUTIC RIDING ORGANIZATIONS THAT OFFER EQUINE EXPERIENCES THAT INSPIRE OR IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF INDIVIDUALS WITH EMOTIONAL, PHYSICAL AND COGNITIVE DISABILITIES. THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS ARE: THERAPEUTIC RIDING ORGANIZATIONS UTILIZING HORSES TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO CHALLENGED OR SPECIAL-NEEDS INDIVIDUALS, FUNDING REQUESTS MUST BE FOR SUPPORT OR ENHANCEMENT OF PROGRAMS IN EXISTENCE FOR A MINIMUM OF THREE YEARS, MUST BE EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER 501(C)(3) OF INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, FUNDING MUST APPLY DIRECTLY TO THE CAUSE WITH NO FUNDS USED FOR ADMINISTRATION OR FUNDRAISING COSTS. RECIPIENTS WILL BE SELECTED BY AMERICAN QUARTER HORSE FOUNDATION'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES. > THE VERDUGO INTERNATIONAL HORSEMANSHIP CAMP IS DESIGNED TO STRENGTHEN HORSEMANSHIP SKILLS IN INTERNATIONAL AFFILIATE COUNTRIES. CAMPS ASSIST INTERNATIONAL HORSE ENTHUSIASTS DEVELOP SKILLS IN: BASIC HORSEMANSHIP, USE OF EQUIPMENT, BEHAVIOR MODIFICATION OF HORSES, NUTRITION, FIRST AID AND VETERINARY CARE. EACH YEAR ACCREDITED UNIVERSITIES WITH A STRUCTURED EQUINE SCIENCES PROGRAM SUBMIT THEIR PROPOSAL TO CONDUCT AN EDUCATIONAL CLINIC FOR INTERNATIONAL HORSE ENTHUSIASTS. PROPOSALS ARE SUBMITTED BY THE NAMED UNIVERSITY TO THE AQHA DIRECTOR OF INTERNATIONAL AFFAIRS AND ARE REVIEWED BY AN AQHA APPOINTED SELECTION COMMITTEE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The 990 is completed with the assistance of the accounting department in conjunction with the Treasurer. The 990 is then reviewed by the Treasurer and the Executive Vice President. The final approval before it is filed comes from the Board of Trustees. The Board of Trustees and the Investment Oversight Committee also serve as the audit committee for the organization. After filing the 990 is available to anyone upon request.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: All Board members are required to fill out the conflict of interest statements on an annual basis. All of these responses are reviewed by the Board of Trustees to determine where conflicts exist.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board of Trustees approves compensation for all staff including the Executive Vice President, Treasurer and key employees. They have comparability data available to review for both non-profit and for-profit corporations. They have received independent reviews of the Executive Vice President's compensation in the past, but it is not done on an annual basis. The documentation of their decisions is reflected in the minutes of the Board of Trustees meetings.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: collects, records and preserves the pedigrees of quarter horses
